TaskDescription.Summary: Recognize an image and get color values
TaskDescription.Detail: Get the color vof the first letter of the Google logo and fill the canvas with the color.

Assist.value: Open a browser and access Google.
Enter the URL to connect to. Type 'https://www.google.com'
Click Run button below and open a browser.
Wait until the logo appears.
After double-click the highlighted box, drag the Google logo.
Get the color of the first letter of the logo.
After double-click the highlighted box, drag the logo and click 'G', the first letter.
Specify a variable to store the color values. Type this.color.
Print and check the color values.
Specify a variable to be printed. Type this.color.
Seperate the color values ​​by commas(,) and store them as an array.
Specify a variable to be converted to an array. Type this.color.
Type the seperator. Type ', '.
Specify a variable to store the converted array. Type this.rgb.
Launch the paint app.
Enter the command of the paint execution. Type 'mspaint.exe'.
Click the 'Fill with color' icon.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Fill with color' icon.
Click the 'Edit colors' icon.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'Edit colors' icon.
Enter the value of red in the 'Edit colors' pop-up.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the input area of Red.
Specify a value of red. Type this.rgb[0].
Enter the value of green in the 'Edit colors' pop-up.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the input area of Green.
Specify a value of green. Type this.rgb[1].
Enter the value of blue in the 'Edit colors' pop-up.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the input area of Blue.
Specify a value of blue. Type this.rgb[2].
Click the 'OK' button in the 'Edit colors' pop-up.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the 'OK' button
Fill the canvas with the color.
After double-click the highlighted box, click the canvas area.
